intro: Rudgea microcarpa, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves. Its fruits are small berries that contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans. Rudgea microcarpa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
